WorkItem.ClosedComment: Fixed for next release, but options panel is not functional.
WorkItem.Description:
Using the online version saved to desktop and whenever I open my Warlock I see the error message below and unable to click any item and rawr crashes and close.
 
[Arg_IndexOutOfRangeException]
Arguments:
Debugging resource strings are unavailable. Often the key and arguments provide sufficient information to diagnose the problem. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=106663&Version=3.0.50106.0&File=mscorlib.dll&Key=Arg_IndexOutOfRangeException
 
   at Rawr.Warlock.CalculationOptionsWarlock.GetBaseHitRate()
   at Rawr.Warlock.CharacterCalculationsWarlock..ctor(Character character, Stats stats)
   at Rawr.Warlock.CalculationsWarlock.GetCharacterCalculations(Character character, Item additionalItem, Boolean referenceCalculation, Boolean significantChange, Boolean needsDisplayCalculations)
   at Rawr.Calculations.GetCharacterCalculations(Character character, Item additionalItem, Boolean referenceCalculation, Boolean significantChange, Boolean needsDisplayCalculations)
   at Rawr.UI.MainPage.character_CalculationsInvalidated(Object sender, EventArgs e)
   at Rawr.UI.MainPage.set_Character(Character value)
   at Rawr.UI.MainPage.armoryLoad_Closed(Object sender, EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Controls.ChildWindow.OnClosed(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Controls.ChildWindow.Close()
   at System.Windows.Controls.ChildWindow.set_DialogResult(Nullable`1 value)
   at Rawr.UI.ArmoryLoadDialog._armoryService_GetCharacterCompleted(Object sender, EventArgs`1 e)
   at Rawr.ElitistArmoryService.bwParseCharacter_RunWorkerCompleted(Object sender, RunWorkerCompletedEventArgs e)
   at System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker.OnRunWorkerCompleted(RunWorkerCompletedEventArgs e)
   at System.ComponentModel.BackgroundWorker.<OnRun>b__1(Object state)

Comments.Message: When you say you "open your warlock", is that from a saved file?  And if so, when was it saved.  Also if so, please always get in the habit of attaching your character file when you create issues.

Excuse for the ambigious phrasing. When I "open" I meant to say to Load From Armory. And by unable to click any item I meant that when I hover the mouse pointer over a item I have a revolving hourglass icon over all the items. When I do click a item Rawr crashes and close. This only happens with my warlock.

I get the same error while importing my Warlock from armory too:

[Arg_IndexOutOfRangeException]
Arguments: 
Debugging resource strings are unavailable. Often the key and arguments provide sufficient information to diagnose the problem. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=106663&Version=4.0.50401.0&File=mscorlib.dll&Key=Arg_IndexOutOfRangeException

If any devs out there would care to help troubleshoot this issue I'd appreciate it.  I don't really want to install 7 software packages including a different IDE just to fix an array-out-of-bounds exception.  (I'm not set up to develop in Rawr 3.)
Yes, it is, read the crapload of duplicates to find out when, how and why
